text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Nakaoka was born in Amagasaki on February 15, 1985. In 1997, she was 12 years old, she debuted in Nadeshiko League at Takarazuka Bunnys. While she was a Honjo Daiichi High School student, she left the league. After graduating from high school, she joined Tasaki Perule FC in 2003. However, the club was disbanded in 2008 due to financial strain. She moved to Speranza FC Takatsuki. In 2012, she moved to Albirex Niigata and retired end of season. On May 21, 2005, when Nakaoka was 20 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against New Zealand. In 2006, she played at 2006 Asian Cup and 2006 Asian Games. She played 14 games for Japan until 2007. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2005 3 0 2006 10 0 2007 1 0 Total 14 0 ==References== Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Hy≈çgo Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Bunnys Kyoto SC players Category:Tasaki Perule FC players Category:Speranza Osaka- Takatsuki players Category:Albirex Niigata Ladies players Category:2006 AFC Women's Asian Cup players Category:Footballers at the 2006 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 2006 Asian Games
title: Maiko Nakaoka
